Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: கொல்லாமை மேற்கொண் டொழுகுவான் வாழ்நாள்மேல்செல்லாது உயிருண்ணுங் கூற்று.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Yama, the destroyer of life, will not attack the life of him, who acts under the determination of never destroying life.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person is walking the path of life. Their path is illuminated by a powerful, protective aura generated by their vow of non-killing ('கொல்லாமை மேற்கொண்டு').
Layered_Composition.Midground: The God of Death, Yama ('கூற்று'), is shown approaching, his purpose to reap the person's life ('உயிர் உண்ணும்').
Layered_Composition.Background: As Yama reaches the edge of the person's protective aura of non-violence, he is stopped. He cannot proceed ('செல்லாது'). He is shown lowering his weapon and turning aside, unable to claim the life of one who has never taken a life. The vow of non-killing has granted them immunity from Death itself.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The God of Death will not take the life of a person who lives by the great principle of not killing.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The aura of non-violence as an impenetrable shield against Death is the central metaphor. Yama is not defeated in a battle, but his own law is superseded by the higher law of non-violence. His turning aside is an act of recognition and respect for this higher law.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The person's aura is a pure, powerful, white-gold light of life. Yama is a being of immense, dark, and terrifying power, but this power is shown to be nullified by the person's virtue. The scene is a standoff where light peacefully overpowers darkness.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A dramatic confrontation shot, showing the terrifying figure of Death being peacefully but absolutely halted by the person's protective aura.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, hyper-realistic, with a majestic and terrifying design for Yama, the God of Death.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: The protective aura is the primary, divine light source that casts a divine light that even the God of Death cannot cross.

Cultural_Anchors: He who lives by the principle of not-killing (கொல்லாமை மேற்கொண்டு ஒழுகுவான்)
